title: torch.sqrt() doesnt work on result of full reduction operations.
body_html:
torch.sqrt() doesnt work on result of full reduction operations:

Currently:

a = torch.rand(3, 2)
print(torch.sqrt(a.sum()))  # Fails
print(sqrt(a.sum()))  # Fails

Neither torch.sqrt work, nor sqrt. We could do import math, and use math.sqrt, but it's an additional import. Probably could use np.sqrt too, but again, additional import. Additional cognitive load "is this a torch.Tensor, or a scalar".

body:
torch.sqrt() doesnt work on result of full reduction operations:

Currently:
```
a = torch.rand(3, 2)
print(torch.sqrt(a.sum()))  # Fails
print(sqrt(a.sum()))  # Fails
```
Neither `torch.sqrt` work, nor `sqrt`.  We could do `import math`, and use `math.sqrt`, but it's an additional import. Probably could use `np.sqrt` too, but again, additional import.  Additional cognitive load "is this a torch.Tensor, or a scalar".
